com.coveros.selenified.selenium

Class Action

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.coveros.selenified.selenium.Action

  • public class Action
extends Object
    A custom Selenium wrapper to handle exceptions that might be thrown as a result of the test step. Slow loading elements are waited for, and any errors thrown are properly recorded and put into the reports, instead of having the tests stop and crash.
    Version:
    2.0.1
    Author:
    Max Saperstone

    • Constructor Detail

      • Action

        public Action(Selenium.Browser browser,
              org.openqa.selenium.remote.DesiredCapabilities capabilities,
              OutputFile file)
       throws InvalidBrowserException,
              MalformedURLException
        the constructor, determining which browser use and how to run the browser: either grid or standalone
        Parameters:
        browser - - the Browser we are running the test on
        capabilities - - what browser capabilities are desired
        file - - the TestOutput file. This is provided by the SeleniumTestBase functionality
        Throws:
        InvalidBrowserException - If a browser that is not one specified in the Selenium.Browser class is used, this exception will be thrown
        MalformedURLException - If the provided hub address isn't a URL, this exception will be thrown

      • Action

        public Action(String serviceBaseUrl,
              String username,
              String password,
              OutputFile file)
        the detailed test results constructor that will setup the our test output file for all documentation and information for services based testing
        Parameters:
        serviceBaseUrl - the base url for access services; e.g. 'http://my.domain.com/services/'
        username - the username needed for basic header authorization - leave null if not needed
        password - the username needed for basic header authorization - leave null if not needed

                 String locator)
        the generic selenium click functionality implemented
        Parameters:
        type - - the locator type e.g. Locator.id, Locator.xpath
        locator - - the locator string e.g. login, //input[@id='login']
        Returns:

      • click

        public int click(Selenium.Locator type,
                 String locator,
                 int elementMatch)
        the generic selenium click functionality implemented
        Parameters:
        type - - the locator type e.g. Locator.id, Locator.xpath
        locator - - the locator string e.g. login, //input[@id='login']
        elementMatch - - if there are multiple matches of the selector, this is which match (starting at 0) to interact with
        Returns:
        Integer: the number of errors encountered while executing these steps

        public int move(Selenium.Locator type,

      • selectFrame

        public int selectFrame(int frameNumber)
        a way to select a frame within a page. Select a frame by its (zero-based) index. That is, if a page has three frames, the first frame would be at index 0, the second at index 1 and the third at index 2. Once the frame has been selected, all subsequent calls on the WebDriver interface are made to that frame.
        Parameters:
        frameNumber - - the frame number, starts at 0
        Returns:
        Integer: the number of errors encountered while executing these steps

      • selectFrame

        public int selectFrame(String frameIdentifier)
        a way to select a frame within a page. Select a frame by its name or ID. Frames located by matching name attributes are always given precedence over those matched by ID.
        Parameters:
        frameIdentifier - - the frame name or ID
        Returns:
        Integer: the number of errors encountered while executing these steps

      • selectFrame

        public int selectFrame(Element element)
        a function to switch to a frame using the element
        Parameters:
        type - - the locator type e.g. Locator.id, Locator.xpath
        locator - - the locator string e.g. login, //input[@id='login']
        elementMatch - - if there are multiple matches of the selector, this is which match (starting at 0) to interact with
        Returns:
        Integer - the number of errors encountered while executing these steps
